IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Cumberland County YMCA is a not-for-profit corporation dedicated to building strong kids, individuals, families and communities through programs and services that promote a healthy spirit, mind and body for all regardless of ability to pay.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Cumberland County YMCA is a not-for-profit corporation dedicated to building strong kids, individuals, families and communities through programs and services that promote a healthy spirit, mind and body for all regardless of ability to pay.
IRS990.Description: Healthy Living - This program focuses on bringing families closer together, encourages good health and fosters connections through fitness, sports, fun and shared interests. Our youth, adult and family members are receiving the support, guidance and resources needed to achieve greater health and well-being for their spirit, mind and body.

Activity2.Description: Youth Development: We believe that all kids deserve the opportunity to discover who they are and what they can achieve. That's why, through the Y, millions of youth today are cultivating the values, skills, and relationships that lead to positive behaviors, better health and educational achievement.YMCA Child Care: This program is part of our Youth Development initiative. The Y believes that all kids deserve the opportunity to discover who they are and what they can achieve. That's why the youth participating in our child care program are cultivating the values, skills, and relationships that lead to positive behaviors, better health and educational achievement. In order to minimize the financial barrier to attend the child care programs.YMCA Day Camp: The Y day camps are another part of our Youth Development initiative and have a goal to help children and teens grow physically, mentally, and spiritually while using a natural camp site. The Y believes that all kids deserve the opportunity to discover who they are and what they can achieve. That's why the youth participating in our day camp programs are cultivating the values, skills, and relationships that lead to positive behaviors, better health and educational achievement. The Y works to remove the financial barrier of attending camp for all children. Financial assistance awarded was $72,360.

Activity3.Description: Social Responsibility - The Cumberland County Y has been listening and responding to our communities' most critical social needs for over 150 years. Whether developing skills or emotional well-being through education and training, welcoming and connecting diverse demographic populations through global services, or preventing chronic disease and building healthier communities through collaborations with policymakers, the Y fosters the care and respect all people need and deserve. Through the Y, hundreds of volunteers and donors, leaders and partners across the country are empowering thousands of people in the Cumberland County area to be healthy, confident,connected and secure.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL AID TO MEMBERS AND PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS AS WELL AS TO SUPPORT THE GENERAL OPERATIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective July 1, 2009, the Organization adopted the provisions of Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes as provided for in the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification. This statement clarifies the criteria that an individual tax position must satisfy for some or all of the benefits of that position to be recognized in an entity's financial statements. It also prescribes a recognition threshold of more likely-than-not, and a measurement attribute for all tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return, in order for those tax positions to be recognized in the financial statements. There was no cumulative effect on the Organization's financial statements related to adoption of these provisions, and no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions were accrued. The Organization is currently open to audit under the statute of limitations by the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing authorities for the years ended June 30, 2007 through 2010.
Change in value of interest in perpetual trusts: 2453.
Change in Value of Interest in Perpetual Trusts $-2,453

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF REDUCED PROGRAM FEES FOR VARIOUS PROGRAMS.
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED IN THE FORM OF REDUCED PROGRAM FEES.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: MEMBER OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO IS ALSO PRESIDENT OF BURGESS ADVERTISING.
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: BURGESS ADVERTISING PROVIDED PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO THE YMCA.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS CONSTITUTED BY MEMBERS WHO SHALL ACCEPT THE PURPOSE AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF MEMBERSHIP WHICH MAY BE DETERMINED FROM TIME TO TIME. ONLY MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION WHO HAVE REACHED THE AGE OF 18 ARE ENTITLED TO VOTE ON ALL MATTERS APPROPRIATE AND PUT TO SUCH MEMBERS FOR A VOTE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS ELECTED BY THE MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE MEMBERSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM, AND THEN PROVIDED IN DRAFT FORM TO THE ORGANIZATION'S CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICE AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER THEN FORWARDED A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR THEIR REVIEW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING THE COURSE OF THE YEAR, RELATIONSHIPS WHICH ARISE WHICH MAY CREATE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE DISCLOSED BY THE DIRECTORS OR OTHER PERSONS INVOLVED AND APPROPRIATE ACTION THEN TAKEN.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS FOR THE CEO ARE DETERMINED BY A REVIEW OF COMPARABLE SALARY INFORMATION FOR OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS, AND THIS PROCESS IS OVERSEEN BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHO THEN APPROVE SUCH DETERMINATIONS. COMPENSATION FOR ALL OTHER OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED THROUGH A SALARY ADMINISTRATION PLAN INVOLVING CONSIDERATION OF COMPARABLE COMPENSATION LEVELS FOR OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THESE MATERIALS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART XI, QUESTION 2C - AUDIT OVERSIGHT:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: This process has not changed from the prior year.

Form990ScheduleRPartI.PrimaryActivities: SERVES AS GENERAL PARTNER IN CCYSRO,LP (EIN 83-0350349)
